      • getRootView

        public android.view.View getRootView()
        Description copied from interface: ViewMvc
        Get the root Android View which is used internally by this MVC View for presenting data to the user.
        The returned Android View might be used by an MVC Controller in order to query or alter the properties of either the root Android View itself, or any of its child Android View's.
        Specified by:
        getRootView in interface ViewMvc
        Returns:
        root Android View of this MVC View

      • getViewState

        public android.os.Bundle getViewState()
        Description copied from interface: ViewMvc
        This method aggregates all the information about the state of this MVC View into Bundle object. The keys in the returned Bundle must be provided as public constants inside the interfaces (or implementations if no interface defined) of concrete MVC views.
        The main use case for this method is exporting the state of editable Android Views underlying the MVC view. This information can be used by MVC controller for e.g. processing user's input or saving view's state during lifecycle events.
        Specified by:
        getViewState in interface ViewMvc
        Returns:
        Bundle containing the state of this MVC View, or null if the view has no state
